class_notes:
Topic:  Advanced Painting
(Permission of Instructor Required Prior to Enrollment)


(Prerequisite: XXX)


This class is open to students who have taken ARTVIS 205 or have a pre-approved portfolio review with the instructor. The course builds on the tools and concepts of painting with a conceptual and aesthetic awareness. Students develop a prospectus to support a painting studio practice in the completion of a significant body of work. Students are expected to devote studio class time to all aspects of their working process, painting, research sketchbook and critique and a significant amount of time beyond class to finish a cohesive final project. 
Prerequisite: ARTVIS 205 or permission of the instructor: katherine.patrice.taylor@emory.edu
course_description: This advanced tutorial uses the tools and concepts of drawing and painting to develop skills in research and project development. Written documentation, oral presentations, critique skills and studio skills that support independent research are developed.
prerequisites: This course requires ARTVIS 205 and ARTVIS 105 or ARTVIS 104 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5240, Section #: 1, Type: LAB, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 1:30-5p, Instructor: K. Taylor, Status: Closed
